content.content: Overview Once upon a time there was more than 70 million DAI minted from YFI. The utilization dropped heavily starting in May, going to zero in August.   As oracles come with operational expenses, we are wasting money here. This collateral seems not be interesting for anyone to mint DAI - we could cut on those expenses if we would offboard YFI as a supported collateral.  Signal Request: Shall we offboard YFI?     No, let’s keep YFI Yes, let’s offboard YFI Abstain     0 voters      Next Steps This Signal Request will run until 2022-10-20T22:00:00Z - its outcome will result in an onchain poll assuming there is majority for offboarding (ignoring abstaining votes). This is a conditional Signal Request: I will withdraw if at least 10 million DAI has been minted until closing.
content.GPT-summary: The author of the post is proposing to offboard YFI as a supported collateral due to the lack of interest in minting DAI from it, which is causing operational expenses. The post includes a signal request with options for the community to vote on whether to offboard YFI or not. A 3rd party could give constructive criticism or ask questions about the proposal.
GPT-discussion-categories: Author of proposal is explaining proposal

content.content: Reserved for GovAlpha Summary
Is there a non-financial but relationship (with Yearn) aspect to be considered before moving with the off boarding?

ultraschuppi:  This is a conditional Signal Request: I will withdraw if at least 10 million DAI has been minted until closing.   Choosing to Abstain for now as 3F Delegate is under the impression that Yearn has an internal Treasury of $25M+++. With a DAI TVL in yearn.finance of under $49M, I am starting to get the idea DAI is not the preferable stablecoin of the platform at the moment. However:  If the Compound D3M is implemented the DAI yVault might see an uptrend in yield, and that might encourage end-users to mint DAI. The proposed yield farming of MetaDAO tokens with DAI might ignite YFI token user to open new vaults.  Hence, we will wait and see how things shape up.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal

content.content: [YFI] - MIP6 Collateral Onboarding - yEarn Collateral Onboarding Applications (MIP6)       Who is the interested party for this collateral application?  ParaFi Capital    Provide a brief high-level overview of the project, with a focus on the applying collateral token.  Yearn.finance (“yEarn”) is a DeFi yield aggregator and optimizer. yEarn uses a suite of DeFi protocols and primitives including yTokens and delegated vaults to maximize yield. YFI is yEarn’s governance token. YFI is an ERC-20 token used to vote on yEarn improvement plans (“YIPs”) and new yield strategies for liquidit…     What I could find is that Yearn and Maker’s vision is similar, “grow the DeFi ecosystem” would be like an exchange of ideals, but other than that it is purely commercial.     flipflopflapdelegate:  If the Compound D3M is implemented the DAI yVault might see an uptrend in yield, and that might encourage end-users to mint DAI.   I’m very optimistic about Maker, but how would users prefer opening vaults in Yearn over opening vaults directly in Maker? excuse my question
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal

YFII Finance is a community-owned DeFi infrastructure where its users determine what products they want and enjoy the yields. It’s permissionless for all the people to join. How an…   What I could find is that Yearn and Maker’s vision is similar, “grow the DeFi ecosystem” would be like an exchange of ideals, but other than that it is purely commercial.   sorry, but YFII is some… weird… other thing than YFI. do not confuse
One quick thought/mental exercize for the future:  can we automate this? so, if a vault starts to go unprofitable after some time (3-6 months) it just turns off?
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal

content.content: I think it might make sense if its a 0 collateral balance for 90 days or something like that (0 DAI in the YFI vaults) If there is a balance though (active vaults), it would be terrible customer experience to close vaults and request repayment. What would happen to the outstanding vaults if this collateral is offboarded? Normal practice is 30 days notice but not sure how we can notify a non-custodial wallet?
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal

content.content: Good questions to start. When we offboarded some collateral in the past there was some commotion and some users got caught by surprise (AAVE for example).     TRUEMAKER:  close vaults and request repayment   Slight nuance and some history for you. This hasn’t happened if I recall correctly, the parameters were tuned so the only option was to close positions before they get offered to the open market. Clearly, there is room for improvement. I would like to think that not having twitter access lead to a lot of the issues with offboarding in the past.     TRUEMAKER:  notify a non-custodial wallet?   If it’s a frontend for individual vault management, I would hope to see an integration like push-- previously EPNS.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal

content.content: Hello from Yearn. We find this facility useful and would love to keep it operational. We have a new version of MakerDAO strategy in the works which should put this collateral type to good use. It is expected to go live in a couple of weeks. However, we accept the stipulation for withdrawing this proposal and are willing to immediately draw 10m DAI using Yearn Treasury as a collateral.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal

content.content: I could attach a link to see this new strategy in more detail. I would like more details, in order to better evaluate the decision since it is more than a year of association, if in any case they have a solution, it can be studied before the reimbursement
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal

content.content: banteg:  We have a new version of MakerDAO strategy in the works which should put this collateral type to good use. It is expected to go live in a couple of weeks. However, we accept the stipulation for withdrawing this proposal and are willing to immediately draw 10m DAI using Yearn Treasury as a collateral.   Inside the on-chain collateral initiative group, we previously hesitated with offboarding YFI in various offboarding rounds as we deemed it as a strategic asset due to possible future Yearn strategy or possibly the treasury could use the vault. Happy to see that it is happening now, and I would recommend against offboarding YFI at the current time.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal

content.content: love to see some love for YFI-A vault again - looking forward to withdraw this SR! however, I wonder why we don’t get those things sorted out in a smoother way

imho Yearn using their treasury to borrow 10m opens up an even bigger issue. It’s a highly concentrated risk on a collateral that no longer has any organic demand. The fact that there was no human usage for the YFI-A clearly shows that. Yearn has a long history of empty promises, zero deliverables and overall bad market strategy that chased out both users and token holders. What happens if the vault becomes undercollateralized and needs to be liquidated? Most likely it will become bad debt as I don’t see anyone wanting to buy that many YFI tokens, at least not at the prices that would cover the debt. I suggest that the YFI-A vault should be closed ASAP. I am open to have this revised if there is ever any organic demand for the YFI token in the future.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal

content.content: As promised, we’ve minted 10m DAI and will soon add another ~8m DAI from a yvYFI strategy. It uses automation and an OSM bypass, so it’s the safest borrower you can have.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal

content.content: thanks @banteg for this quick action! <3 @GovAlphaBot as the conditional of the Signal Request is now met - I’d like to withdraw it.
This Signal Request has been withdrawn as the target amount of DAI has now been minted.
Looks like the 10M position on YFI was closed and it is back to 0.    makerburn.com    makerburn.com Dashboard for watching DAI minting and MKR token burning in real time.

content.content: It has been open for almost a month, you can’t really be considered a partner for MAKER, it’s too little commitment.

Let’s remember the context: Due to liquidity concerns, we lowered the debt ceiling to $10M, which is what this thread initially proposed the minimum borrow is to keep the YFI vault open. It’s no longer a reasonable ask.     banteg:  As promised, we’ve minted 10m DAI  and will soon add another ~8m DAI from a yvYFI strategy. It uses automation and an OSM bypass, so it’s the safest borrower you can have.   Maybe they are preparing to use the alluded-to yYFI strategy (which was estimated to consume $8M of debt) and needed to free up some space to do so.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal

content.content: This topic was automatically closed 30 days after the last reply. New replies are no longer allowed.
